page.title: 17Arts and Crafts
page.content: Cardross Church has 3 beautiful embroidered panels gifted by Elizabeth Hendry. An artist Hannah Frew Paterson was commisioned to create them. The 3 panels form the shape of a hill, making a setting for the cross. Each panel depicts the development of life. The left hand panel shows the view inland from Cardross. The lower section shows roots, seeds flowers and plants. Each flower has a biblical significance. Above are the fields and hills of Cardross with a beautiful gold Cedar of Lebanon. The right panel shows the view across the Clyde. The lower section depicts minerals below the earth, the upper the ship building industry. The central shows the development of human life from the cell to the baby.A family is gathered round the Cross, merging with a crowd, depicting all mankind.
